name: Cox's Bazar
description: Cox's Bazar is a coastal city in southeastern Bangladesh, known for its long sandy beach and is a popular tourist destination. The beach is lined with hundreds of small shops and vendors, offering local souvenirs and seafood.

name: Sundarbans
description: The Sundarbans is a mangrove forest in the delta of the Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers on the Bay of Bengal. It is home to the Bengal tiger and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The forest also has a diverse array of flora and fauna.

name: Srimangal
description: Srimangal is a town located in the northeastern part of Bangladesh, known for its tea gardens and rainforest. It is often referred to as the tea capital of Bangladesh and attracts many visitors who come to explore the tea estates and the surrounding nature.

name: Paharpur
description: Paharpur is an archaeological site in the northwest of Bangladesh, containing the ruins of an ancient Buddhist monastery dating back to the 8th century. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most important archaeological sites in South Asia.

name: Bandarban
description: Bandarban is a hill district in southeastern Bangladesh, known for its beautiful landscape, waterfalls, and trekking trails. The district is home to several ethnic minorities and has a unique cultural heritage.

name: Lalbagh Fort
description: Lalbagh Fort is an incomplete 17th-century Mughal fort complex in Dhaka, Bangladesh. It is a popular tourist destination and a must-visit place for history buffs. The fort complex includes several structures such as the mosque, the audience hall, and the tomb of Shaista Khan.
